turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: We do appreciate the way you have taken it upon yourself to meet the other patients.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: This is your bed. You may leave your things in that cabinet.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Please use your time to familiarize yourself with your new home and if there is anything you need to know, don't hesitate to ask us.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Now that you mention it, I sure would like to call my aunt up in Portland and tell 'er where I am so she can come visit me.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: All in good time, Mister McMurphy. All in good time.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Good. Now if you'll just go along with Mister Washington, he'll see that you're properly oriented.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Just that I'm glad to be here, Miss Ratched. I really am.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Good. I'm sure we'll be friends.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, you ain't half so bad looking for a head nurse.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes. Now go along, Mister McMurphy. Go along.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.  Lead the way, Sam.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy, this ward is a democratic community run by the patients and their votes, so you should feel at ease in your new surroundings to the extent you can freely discuss emotional problems in front of the patients and staff. However, the cardinal rule, and I must emphasize this: Everyone keeps their seat during the meeting!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, well, it just pains me somethin' awful to see a full growed man sloshing around in his own water...

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes... We were discussing Mister Harding's problem with his wife. Now, who will start?  Billy.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy. Patients aren't allowed in here.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Pardon me, ma'am, can I ask you somethin'?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: How 'bout turning off that music for a while so a man can hear himself think?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: That music is for everyone, Mister McMurphy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, say, how 'bout easin' it down a bit so a man don't have to shout!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy, there are old men here who couldn't hear the music at all if it were lower. That music is all they have, and I wish you wouldn't lean against the glass there, your hands are staining the window.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: That's all right, Miss Pilbow, if Mister McMurphy does not wish to take his medication orally, he may...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: No, that's okay, ma'am. Down it goes.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy, patients are not permitted to run around in towels.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, some creep stole my cigarettes!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Patients are rationed to one pack of cigarettes a day.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Now you boys hurry along and wash up for breakfast...  You too, Mister McMurphy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, say. How 'bout springing a pack of cigarettes loose?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: After breakfast, Mister McMurphy, after breakfast.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You sure run a tight-assed ship 'round here, don't ya!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes. Now run along like a good boy and see that you wash up properly.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Right... I've been givin' some serious consideration to what you told me about the democratic something of this therapeutic community of ours, an' I got a few things I wanna get off my chest, before we get back to Harding's problem.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: 'Kay, item two. Tomorrow, and listen carefully to me, you ding-a lings. Tomorrow is the opening game of the World Series an' what I want is to take a vote on switchin' the group meetin' to later on in the day, so we can watch the ballgame.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Please understand, the schedule has been set up for a delicately balanced reason that would be thrown into turmoil by a switch of routines.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: The hell with the schedule, you can get back to the schedule next week when the series is over. What I want is a vote on it right now!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Yes. Now was there anything else you wanted to discuss, Mister McMurphy?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: That was the first time you attempted to commit suicide, wasn't it?  You must try to talk about it, Billy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, the man doesn't want to talk, so get off his back an' let's get on to some new business.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy, the purpose of this meeting is therapy. Group therapy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, the hell with that crap! The World Series is goin' on right' now an' that's therapy also!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Let me pose a question to the group: do any of you feel that Mister McMurphy is perhaps imposing his personal desires on you too much?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What the hell does that have to do with it? This is an important event and I want a vote on it!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Very well. What is it you're proposing, Mister McMurphy?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I'm proposing a re-vote on watchin' the ballgame!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: A vote is before the group.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Okay, I wanna see the hands. I wanna see which of you birds has any guts.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Everyone in favor of changing the schedule raise his hand.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, I count only eight.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: But there are eighteen patients on the ward, Mister McMurphy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You mean to tell me you're gonna count those old birds over there?

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, but you must have a majority to change ward policy.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister McMurphy, you are deliberately violating the rules!...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: He's into his wind-up. Here comes the pitch. Strike on the inside corner!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: He's into his wind-up. Here's the next pitch... and it's a hit! It's a hit!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, ya should've come along with us, Miss Ratched, an' gotten a little sun on your cheeks and maybe caught a fish or two.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mr. McMurphy, you had no right to take these men out with you!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, that's kind of crazy, ain't it!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Ma'am, I'm as gentle as a puppy dog. Why, I haven't licked the tar out of an aide for two weeks! Hi ya, Doc!

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Good. Why don't you join us?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Why, thank you, ma'am...  Whew. Man, I tell you, that place up there is somethin' else!  Well, ya boys been practicin' up for the big game?  I figured as much...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Miss Ratched, would you please save a space for my aunt? She's comin' down from Portland.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Mister Washington, why don't we get a good head start on the day by shaving Mister Bromden and see if we can't avoid a disturbance.

turns.speaker: BIG NURSE
turns.text: Put him in Doctor Spivey's office!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shoot! No wonder you don't care nothin' 'bout showin' your hand.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, put 'er there, Billy boy, my name's McMurphy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What I wanna know is who's the top loony around here?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Y-Y-You m-mean th-the pr-president of the P-P-Patients C-Council?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: H-H-Harding, the m-m-man w-wants to t-talk to you, y-you're the pr-pr pr...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Y-y-yes! Yes! Y-y-y-you s-s-saw wh wh-what she c-c-can do to us!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What did I see 'cept a grown man gettin' whipped so bad he can't laugh anymore.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Break it up, God dammit! Ain't I got enough troubles without you guys messin' around... can't depend on nobody.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Some of us ha-ha-have b-b-been here a long t-t-time, Randle, and will b b-be here long after this Wo-Wo World Series of yours is oh-oh-oh, what's the use anyway...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: M-M-Mack, y-y-y-you c-c-can't l-l lift that thing!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Stand aside, son. Any more takers?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: No, kid, it was my own stupidity, that's what pissed me off.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What we're gonna have to do is pull this ballclub together for our next play. 'Kay!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hey, Billy. Billy boy, wake up and say goodbye to your ol' buddy.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Come on, don't crap out on me now. We got two buddies out there!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I-I d-d-don't know! M-M-Miss R Ratched g-g-g-g...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, shoot, man! Whadaya say we take ourselves a little spin around the place.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Your horses are hungry, That's what she did say, Come sit down beside me, An' feed them some hay. My horses ain't hungry, They wontt eat your hay-ay-aeee...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Soo, fare-the-weel, darlin'. I'm gone on my way, My wagons are loaded, My whip's in my hand...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Ease up on the star drag, keep the tie up, up and work hell outta that fella.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: C-C-Come here and l-look at th this!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Just fine, Billy boy, just fine. Full of piss an' vinegar! They checked my plugs and cleaned my points...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: W-W-We h-heard y-you w-were n-never c-c-coming back!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, well, let me tell ya somethin'... While I was up there gettin' in-lightened, I came up with one hellava plan...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Ah-ah-ah-are y-y-y-you g-g-g-going t-t-t-to muh-muh-muh-marry her?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Candy? Hell no, Billy, she's just a good friend, that's all...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Wu-wu-wu I-I-I-I th-th-think sh-sh sh-she's th-th-th-the ma-ma-ma-most bu-bu-bu-beautiful wu-wu-wu-woman in th-th-the whole world!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: It's okay, kid. Everything it going to be okay... I'll come back an' getcha in a while... 'Kay...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: P-p-p-please duh-duh-duh-duh t-t tell, M-M-M-Miss R-R-Ratched, y-y you don't need to!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Goddammit, you sly son-of-a-bitch! Does anybody else know?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shit! This is too much!  Chief, I tell you we're gonna bust outta this place an' make it all the way to Canada before they know what bit 'em.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, well, well, well. 'Bout time the rest of the world got a gander at Big Chief Bromden cuttin' down the boulevard, stopping just long enough for virgins... Oh, man, I tell you, I tell you, you'll have women trippin' you and beating you to the floor...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shhh, Chief, don't talk. Never talk! Remember, this is just between you an' me. Do ya understand?

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Pssst! Hey Rose! There they are!

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: It's okay, Rose. You can go with him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Oh yeah! Well if ya don't mind, I'll decide on my own date!

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Shit, Rose! What's there to decide? There's only four of us.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Whaddaya talkin' about? There's at least twenty guys in there. Let's wake 'em up and get this party on the road.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Go with him, Rose. Go with him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well, okay, but I just want to look at the facilities. That's all.

turns.speaker: CHESWICK
turns.text: She won't give me any more cigarettes!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: That okay. I'll take your marker. How many ya want?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Ha! Did ya see that!  Hey, Cheswick!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Let me get on your shoulders.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shhh... That's for me to know an' you to find out.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Charlie, ya can't ever let those goons outta ya sight! Understand!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I dunno. Where do ya wanna go?

turns.speaker: CHESWICK
turns.text: When do you think we'll be going back, Mack?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Come here a minute, Cheswick. You, too, Sefelt. Hey, all you guys, come over here, I wanna show you somethin'.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Tell 'er to go straight to hell!

turns.speaker: FREDRICKSON
turns.text: Which gets you shipped up to Disturbed for a nice little zap job.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: So long, Freddy. Don't take any wooden nickles.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: We'll go back just as soon as we find those guys! 'Kay?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: He's a big flounder. Could weigh two, three hundred. You got to lift him in with a winch.

turns.speaker: FREDRICKSON
turns.text: Does that mean we have to cut him loose?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Like hell we will! We got the muscle standing right here. All we need is a couple gaffin' hooks and some rope.

turns.speaker: SEFELT
turns.text: Yeah, Harding, where do you breathe anyway?

turns.speaker: FREDRICKSON
turns.text: Christ, they even got my first grade report card here...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I'm seeing what a busy man does.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, say, buddy, is that the usual pro-cedure for those Group Ther'py shindigs? Bunch of chickens at a peckin' party?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: That's right, buddy. And you want to know who pecks the first peck?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: It's as simple as that. You've been on our ward six hours and have already simplified the work of Freud, Jung and Maxwell Jones in one grand analogy: it's a pecking party.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I'm not talking about Fred Yoong or Maxwell Jones, buddy, what I'm talkin' about is that crummy meeting and what that nurse did to you!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Did to you and all the rest of you guys.

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Miss Ratched is a competent psychiatric nurse, not some, some kind of monster pecking out our eyes!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: She ain't peckin' at your eyes, buddy.

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Electro-Shock Therapy, my friend. Five cents' worth of electricity and you are out of everybody's hair.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Tell 'er to go to hell anyway!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: And if you persist in your ways, they can always ship you over to Medical Surgery.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Is that your sense of humor or are you tryin' to say somethin'?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Now, what would I be trying to say?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You boys seem to think you've got a champ in there, huh?

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: I don't see you scoring any points, buddy. And you're just the man for the job, right?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hell, I couldn't get it up over old hatchet-face if ya paid me!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: She's not all that homely, Mister McMurphy. In fact, she must have been a rather beautiful young lady.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What's the use! Hooee! It'd do you birds some good just to get a little exercise lifting your arms to vote!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: A baseball game isn't worth the risk, my friend.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: It is to me! An' if I hafta bust way outta this place to see it, I will!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: And how do you propose to accomplish that little feat, my friend?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: That's between me an' myself. So why don't you boys just shove off. I got some planning to do.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: With this thing! I'm gonna put this thing right through the window, that's how!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: You mean you're going to try to pick that thing up and shove it through the window?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You heard me the first time!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah... Okay, stand aside, you guys! You're usin' up my oxygen!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I know, goddammit! You don't have ta tell me that!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: So why are you talking to him?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I'm not talkin' to him! I'm talkin' to myself! It helps me think!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, it doesn't hurt him either!  Does it, Chief!  See, it doesn't hurt him.  Jump! An' put it in!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: That's nice. Send me a post card.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Plan?... Oh, yeah, the plan... Yeah...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Ya deaf! I said pass the ball!

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: What are you talking about??? Everybody was covered!!! Everybody was covered!!!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I was open! Come on, let's play ball!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Time in!  Hold it! Time out!  I said Harding out!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hey, Harding, wake me in an hour.
